text: I rmember a while back there was a discussion about a decent audio system for music.. does anyone remember what the <#C680MM7D4|random> consensus ended up being?

elements.text: I rmember a while back there was a discussion about a decent audio system for music.. does anyone remember what the
consensus ended up being?
consensus among audiophiles?

text: I vaguely remember it being pretty reasonable and not insane

but could be mistaken!

text: the best is audiophiles who don't really understand the concept of digital signals so they'll swear up and down some USB cable gives better audio quality

text: there's also the whole people not understanding that 16 bit signal means 96 decibels, so you won't hear any digital noise from that

text: I also find that Tidal has better sound than Spotify, so that gives you my ambition level. It should decode the MQA, but I’ve not tried yet.

attachments.title: Streaming Migration tidal | Algoriddim
attachments.text: As of July 1, 2020, Spotify will no longer be playable through 3rd party DJ apps. To help djay users with this change, we’ve introduced new streaming services with the option to transfer your music from Spotify.

elements.text: Three months tidal:
https://www.algoriddim.com/streaming-migration/tidal

text: This iPad 10.5” also has pretty decent sound if I’m not directly comparing.

elements.text: This iPad 10.5” also has pretty decent sound if I’m not directly comparing.

text: After the discussion we had (which I think stated in random) I ended up buying a Topping DS10 DAC which was exactly the high bang for the buck item I was after

elements.text: After the discussion we had (which I think stated in random) I ended up buying a Topping DS10 DAC which was exactly the high bang for the buck item I was after

text: I needed a USB in, a SPDIF in, and a volume knob. It’s usually between my TV and the Genelecs.

elements.text: I needed a USB in, a SPDIF in, and a volume knob. It’s usually between my TV and the Genelecs.

text: Trying to control volume with the small volume knobs that the Genelecs have was a bit cumbersome.

elements.text: Trying to control volume with the small volume knobs that the Genelecs have was a bit cumbersome.

text: I had a USB DAC earlier, but it just stopped working at some MacOS upgrade.

elements.text: I had a USB DAC earlier, but it just stopped working at some MacOS upgrade.

text: I have tried many USB DACs with various macs and I always get the same problem: the usb audio cuts out and stops working and the only way to fix it is to unplug the DAC and plug it back in

elements.text: I have tried many USB DACs with various macs and I always get the same problem: the usb audio cuts out and stops working and the only way to fix it is to unplug the DAC and plug it back in

text: I just gave up and started doing audio out of HDMI which is a bit janky

elements.text: I just gave up and started doing audio out of HDMI which is a bit janky
